content:
<h1 class='centered'>User Interface: hyperLinkWebApp</h1>
<br>
<div>
  <b>Abstract</b>
  <p>
    The user interface has two main uses passive and active
  </p>
  <ol>
    <li>
      Passive - A passive user simply reads the information on the screen and utilizes the 
      hyper-linking functionaly to gain a better understanding of the topic at an accelerated rate.
      <br>
      hyper-links come in two different types:
      <ol>
        <li>
          URL - A link to another page/state. These links come in two different types:
          <ol>
            <li>
              Absolute - this needs to be the full web address, and all references will be opened 
              in a new tab.
            </li>
            <li>
              SREF - this link will simply be the hyper-path for an internal page. These links will 
              load in the same tab.
            </li>
          </ol>
        <li>
          Keywords - These are words that are used often and can be defined within a small pop-up below
          the word.
        </li>
      </ol>
    <li>
      Active - This is a user who takes part in modifying the content.
      <ol>
        <li>Content</li>
        <li>Data</li>
        <li>Keywords</li>
        <li>Links</li>
        <li>Css</li>
      <ol>
    </li>
  <ol>
</div>

keywords.Active: <p>An active user takes part in modifying the content.</p>
keywords.Absolute: <p>this needs to be the full web address, and all references will be opened in a new tab.</p>
keywords.URL: <p>A link to another page/state. These links come in two different types:</p>
keywords.Passive:
<p>
  A passive user simply reads the information on the screen and utilizes the hyper-linking 
  functionaly to gain a better understanding of the topic at an accelerated rate. 
</p>

_keywords.Key Inheritance:
<p>
 This type of inheritance is path based.
 <br>
 The hyper-path of this page is angularjs.hyperLinkWebApp. This means the hyper-keys will come from both angularjs and 
 angularjs.hyperLink with a preference for angularjs.hyperLink. 
</p>
_keywords.hyper-path: <p>This is the unique Idetifier for  a hyperLinkWebApp. This will be the last value in the url, i.e. angularjs.hyperLinkWebApp for this page.</p>
_keywords.hyper-key: <p>This is a word or phrase that is associated with a keyword-html or a link</p>
_keywords.keyword-html: Keywords are links that do not need their own web page and they can be summarized in short popup text underneath the word.
_keywords.Modular Key Inheritance:
<p>
  Inheritance that can be restricted to a given section of html. This is mainly to increase the utility for non technical works.
  <br>
  <b>For instance:</b>
  <br>
  Say you wanted to create a hyper-page on economics. You would need a section on Kaynes and Hayek. You would want the keys from 
  both pages but only over thier respective sections.
</p>
_keywords.hyper-page:
<p>
  A web-page or more accuratly a state of the hyperLinkApp.
_keywords.Multiple global Key Inheritance:
<p>
  Allowing a page to inherit keys from multiple sources. Multi inheritance can be confusing but I believe the benifit
  out-weighs the costs here.   
  <br>
  <br>
  <b>For example:</b>
  <br>
  <br>
  If you want to put a piece of code in your page that uses angular, and jquery. It might be good to include angularjs, 
  jquery, and even programming.basics keywords. The result could be literally every word has a link or definition,
  helping readers of any skill level.
</p>
_keywords.Syntax Highlighting:
<p>
  Syntax highlighting is a must if this application is to be successful. An important advantage, of this app, is modifying 
  content in real time in the web browser and it is suffering because plan text makes html, css, and json more difficult.
</p>
_keywords.Html and Css text autofill:
<p>
  I think it is safe to say that one of the inspirations for this application was the in browser dev 
  tools. The css auto fill functionality is extremely useful and it needs to be a part of this 
  application. Might as well also add json and html auto-fill.
</p>
_keywords.Html validation:
<p>
  Html Validation is important because:
  • Poorly writing html could disable the interface and make a hyper-page unusable
  • Html has no standards because of browser magic fixes. Enforcing standards on this sight may help clean the html trash that litters the world.
</p>
_keywords.Helpful Json . Html error messages:
<p>
  I think this interface could go a long way to introducing people to markup and programming 
  concepts. If useful error messages can be incorperated it will drastically increase the user 
  base.
</p>
_keywords.Keyword: <p>These are words that are used often and can be defined within a small pop-up below the word.</p>
_keywords.SREF: <p>this link will simply be the hyper-path for an internal page. These links will load in the same tab.</p>
